meta.description: High-level design system guidelines inferred from reference marketing and product visuals. Optimized so AI agents can recreate the same look and feel across web and mobile surfaces.
intendedUse: Guide AI when generating UI layouts and components.
Serve as a single source of truth for visual and interaction style.
Align product, design, and engineering around a consistent look.

foundations.overallTone: Modern, trustworthy fintech with soft gradients, friendly rounded shapes, and clear hierarchy. Feels secure, optimistic, and approachable rather than flashy.

colors.description: Use a cool, luminous palette dominated by blue and purple gradients with plenty of white surfaces and soft neutrals.

usage: Highlights in hero sections and major navigation.
Graphical accents in cards and banners.
Secondary actions, pill backgrounds, and subtle emphasis text.
Icons and small visual indicators in hero sections and dashboards.

heroMain.description: Large background gradients for hero sections and marketing cards.

ctaPrimary.description: Gradient for the most important CTAs when needed; can also use solid primary.

cardAccent.description: Subtle gradient headers or side strips on feature cards.

typography.description: Clean, highly legible, geometric sans-serif with strong support for Arabic and Latin. Use generous line spacing and clear hierarchy.

displayXL.usage: Hero headlines on marketing pages and major empty states.

displayL.usage: Section titles and major dashboard headings.

h1.usage: Main title in cards and important screens.

h3.usage: Row titles, labels above key values.

bodyL.usage: Primary reading text for marketing copy and descriptions.

bodyM.usage: Supporting text inside cards, list items, and labels.

buttonLabel.usage: CTA labels and primary interactive elements (always uppercase or title case, high contrast).

spacing.description: Consistent, airy spacing with clear breathing room around cards and major elements. Use an 8px base grid.
rules: Use at least 16px padding inside most cards and containers.
Space stacked elements at 8–16px depending on hierarchy importance.
Maintain large outer margins (24–32px) for main layouts, especially on marketing pages.
Bottom nav and app bars should have slightly tighter vertical padding (8–12px) to feel compact yet touch-friendly.

radii.description: Soft, friendly rounding drives the brand. Cards and buttons feel pill-like and modern.
rules: Use 20–28px radius for big surfaces like hero cards and mobile device frames.
Use pill radius for major CTAs and navigation pills.
Tables, lists, and simple containers use 12px radius with subtle shadows.

shadows.description: Subtle, soft shadows to lift key elements from the gradient or neutral background.

layout.description: Right-to-left layout with strong central focal card on marketing visuals and stacked sections on web and mobile.
rules: On marketing pages, keep the hero illustration (e.g., phone mockup) centered or slightly offset with large gradient background and supporting text to the side.
Navigation and key CTAs align to the flow of the reading direction (RTL for Arabic, mirrored for LTR as needed).
Use max-width containers for web content to avoid overly wide lines (~1040–1200px).
On mobile, prioritize a scrollable vertical stack with a prominent top area (balance, hero actions) and card-based content below.

topNavBar.description: Website top navigation bar with logo, menu links, language switch, and a dark primary login button.

layout.rtlBehavior: Logo on far right, primary CTA button on far left, navigation links centered between.

elements: Brand logo on a white or very light surface with subtle gradient badge.
Horizontal nav links with minimal underline or indicator for active section.
Language switch (e.g., Arabic/English) as text link or small chip.
Prominent login button with dark background and pill radius.

heroSection.description: First fold area on marketing pages with gradient background, bold headline, and central device or illustration.
elements: Short preheadline or trust signals (e.g., secure, fast, reliable) often with icons.
Bold RTL headline in display size, dark text on light gradient or vice versa.
One or two lines of supporting copy explaining the core value.
Primary CTA button and optional secondary text link.
Floating device or card mockup with soft shadow and rounded corners.
principles: Keep the hero simple and focused on one key message.
Use large gradients and subtle geometric overlays in the background to add depth.
Maintain sufficient contrast between headline text and background (use white text on intense gradients, dark text on pale gradients).

button.description: Primary interactive element with pill-shaped silhouette and clear text. High contrast and generous padding.

chip.description: Small pill-shaped labels used for status, trust markers (e.g., secure, fast), or filters.

card.description: Primary container for content both in the app UI and marketing designs. Always white or very light with strong rounding and soft shadow.

floatingStats.description: Small floating stat/badge anchored near a larger card or device mockup.

rules: Never place primary content directly on a strong gradient; instead, use a white or soft card on top of the gradient.
Keep content aligned to RTL direction, with main values closer to the visible edge.
Use icons and small illustrations in the header region to indicate the card’s purpose (e.g., cashback, international transfer).

listItem.description: Row-style items for histories, lists of services, or navigation within a card.
content: Leading icon or avatar with subtle circular background.
Primary label (service name, merchant, or category).
Value or chevron indicator on the opposite edge.

bottomNavBar.description: Mobile bottom navigation for up to 5 primary destinations.

tabs.description: Underlined navigation for sections (e.g., investment, offers).

inputField.description: Text input fields used for login, forms, and search.

modal.description: Centered dialog for critical flows such as confirmations and sensitive transactions.
elements: Icon or small illustration reinforcing the action.
Headline, short description, and supporting details.
Primary and secondary buttons anchored to the bottom.

toast.description: Small notification for transient feedback (success, error, info).

visual: Always prioritize clarity and trust: clean lines, sufficient whitespace, and clear separation between interactive and decorative elements.
Use gradients for large background areas and major focal points, not for dense content blocks.
Keep the palette cool and calm, with blue and purple as primary brand colors and white cards on top for legibility.
Favor rounded shapes and soft corners for all main components to communicate approachability and modernity.
layout: Default to RTL for Arabic content: primary navigation, headlines, and values should start on the right.
On smaller screens, stack sections vertically with a strong top section and clear separation between blocks using spacing and background shifts.
Use alignment and grouping to convey relationships—related items share cards, spacing, or subtle background changes.
Keep a consistent visual rhythm using the 8px spacing grid and repeating card patterns.
interaction: Primary actions must always stand out via color, size, or both; never place two equally strong CTAs side by side.
Hover and pressed states should be smooth and subtle: small changes in elevation, color, or scale, not harsh transformations.
Communicate status with color and iconography together (e.g., check icons with success color, warning icons with warm color).
Avoid surprises: navigation and key flows (home, cards, transfers) should remain in predictable, consistent locations.
content: Use concise, benefit-focused headlines; keep supporting copy short and scannable.
Surface key numbers and statuses prominently (e.g., balance, last transaction) with clear labels.
Use microcopy to reinforce trust and security, especially around sensitive actions.
Prefer everyday language over technical jargon; explain concepts clearly when financial terms are necessary.
